entry.title: Seven minutes in heaven
entry.summary:
Author: NightWrites_leaf

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 231,703Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 666

Summary: Dick Grayson thought it would be harmless, one chill night where the Young Justice crew and the Titans could actually relax together. No missions. No explosions. Just friends, laughter… and maybe a little too much alcohol. But when a round of Never Have I Ever spirals into Seven Minutes in Heaven, Dick and Wally find themselves a little too close in the dark — and suddenly, nothing feels simple anymore. Or;Wally and Dick’s developing relationship, full of tension, tenderness, and the two of them absolutely failing to keep their hands to themselves.

entry.title: If I Were
entry.summary:
Author: Sazzysavvy

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,544Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 207

Summary: M'gann loves Conner. And Conner loves her. And if sometimes she morphs into someone else for him, that's fine. Right? When they fuck up, and a senior League member find out, what will be the fallout? What will be the price to pay?This was inspired by that one scene in Young Justice where M'gann morphed into Black Canary and made out with Conner. I'm not a huge fan of M'gann, but after that scene, my thoughts just exploded, contemplating M'gann's abilities, her lack of boundaries, and desire to please Conner. It's hard enough figuring out sex as a regular teenager. But what if you were a shapeshifting, telepathic Martian? What kind of trouble could you get up to? And of course Superbat, because that relationship is still my North Star.

entry.title: I Know You’re Tired, Well I’m Tired Too
entry.summary:
Author: Kingiic

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,467Chapters: 6/30Kudos: 12

Summary: Light, all consuming and wet. The chords of blackness receded from the peripherals of his vision. Nothing remained of the evidence. The beast from seconds ago was nothing more than a literal stain on Gordon’s white button up. And Light; totally absolute in its buzzing heat. Gordon lifted his arm to shield his eyes from the beams. In an instant, the light dulled. Gordon took a moment to rub his eyes and readjust himself before looking at the six-foot bat signal pointing directly at him. Perched on the metal neck, standing just behind the dimmed light, stood the half-illuminated silhouette of the Batman. “We need to talk.” Began the familiar voice, low and stern. “Are you functional?”______________ Someone is making clones of this world’s most powerful individuals, Gotham is battling fascism and corruption in the midst of a mayoral race, and Batman must learn how to fight fire with fire, or else he'll have to make a few new friends.

entry.title: Do I Wanna Know?
entry.summary:
Author: Deluv_011

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,095Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 334

Summary: Damian Wayne and Conner Kent form an unexpected couple. However, few knew that behind that façade, each of them had their heart burning for someone else. Thus, Damian and Conner cling to each other as a distorted reflection of what they truly long for. Damian yearns for Jon Kent. Conner pines for Tim Drake. And the deeper they fall into that strange relationship, the more they begin to notice certain glances among their teammates… glances that reveal far more than mere friendship.

entry.title: [Podfic] real house
entry.summary:
Author: Dr_Fumbles_McStupid

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 51Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: “I wanted to be an astronomer," Clark spoke. “As a kid,” he added. His voice was cracked from screaming and his throat raspy. His words were not loud enough to echo, even empty as the space was. Bruce’s rhythmic breathing was disrupted–he must have been meditating.Giving up on the pretense of sleep, Bruce rolled so his back was no longer facing Clark, stared back at him across the small room. “Yeah?” he asked. His voice was not cracked from screaming–rather, raw from crying. - Missing scene from Bruce's and Clark's time captured in LubaniaPodfic of real house by i_loved_you.

entry.title: Seeing Red and Blue
entry.summary:
Author: Mauve_Muse

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,469Chapters: 5/9Kudos: 57

Summary: Lex Luthor knew how to stop Superman from flying—he just had to fly him somewhere else first. He thought his bases were covered. Then the alien's words echoed back to him, revealing the bat-shaped hole in his otherwise genius plan. Batman was a problem. Batman was the one rumored to monitor Superman’s vitals, who had ships that could cross galaxies, who likely had contingencies for red-sun scenarios, and—more importantly—the one man who would never stop looking. If Superman vanished, Batman would be on his heels before Lex had even cleared the atmosphere. So Batman had to go too. OR Superbat is stranded on a red sun planet <3

entry.title: Take a chance on me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,439Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 15

Summary: Aileen Allen was recruited into the Avatar Program at twenty-two after drawing RDA attention for her effectiveness in close-quarters security operations where escalation repeatedly failed. She wasn’t chosen for aggression, but for control—she ended threats quickly and quietly in environments where firearms were a liability. The RDA classified her as difficult: independent, resistant to rigid command, and openly critical of excessive force. Those traits would normally have ended her candidacy. Dr. Grace Augustine intervened, citing Aileen’s adaptability and restraint as exactly what the program lacked. On Pandora, Aileen immediately modified her uniform for mobility and heat, ignoring protocol in favour of survival. She demonstrated an unusual tendency to de-escalate Na’vi encounters rather than provoke them, earning Grace’s quiet approval—and RDA’s suspicion. By the time Jake Sully arrived, Aileen was already operating on the fringe of RDA control: respected by the scientists, tolerated by command, and trusted by Grace to act when others would make things worse.Pandora didn’t recruit Aileen Allen. Grace Augustine did.

entry.title: And you can quote me on that
entry.summary:
Author: maruja35

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,105Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 46

Summary: In a deviation from expectations, Clark and Bruce meet for the first time not as Superman and Batman, and not as reporter and billionaire business owner, but as some version of themselves somewhere in the middle of all their respective identities.Clark nods, pushes his glasses back into place, smiles. It's sweet. It's comfortable. Bruce feels a sense of peace — there's no need to rush this. He steals one last kiss, then walks back to his car.He remembers to text Clark later, when he's back at the manor and before patrol, letting him know he made it home safe and wishing him a good night.He sees Clark again, unplanned, unexpected, Saturday night.OrAfter the Rift, Clark keeps moving. He's a bit lonely, a bit less trusted than he was before, a bit optimistic about a budding new friendship - relationship? He's determined not to mess things up, but he will. Things never work out just right. Meanwhile, Bruce throws caution to the wind and lets someone in for a change. He thinks it's fine, until he makes eye contact with him from across the room and feels the cool knife of betrayal slide between his ribs. It only gets more complicated from there.
